title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Wagner Chief in Exile
description: Also, American views on China continue to sour.

title: Deadly Russian Missile Strike Hits Kramatorsk Restaurant
description: More than 40 people were wounded in the strike, which hit a popular restaurant in Kramatorsk’s city center at dinnertime.

title: E.U. Border Agency Considers Pulling Out of Greece Over Migrant Abuses
description: Days after the deadliest shipwreck in the Mediterranean in years, an E.U. official said that Greek authorities continue violating the rights of migrants.

title: A Proto-Pizza Emerges from a Fresco on a Pompeii Wall
description: That doughy disc with delectable toppings seen in a 2,000-year-old painting is not a pizza, experts insist. But can we get one delivered anyway?

title: Tourist Filmed Carving Girlfriend’s Name Into Rome’s Colosseum
description: A man decided to immortalize his visit by scratching “Ivan + Hayley 23/6/23” into a brick, using his keys.

title: Putin Tries to Rewrite the Story of What Happened With Wagner Mutiny
description: President Vladimir V. Putin appeared only once during a mercenary boss’s daylong mutiny against the military. He was all over Russian TV on Tuesday, seeking to project an image of control.

title: Sierra Leone’s President Bio Wins Re-election
description: The small West African nation, one of the world’s poorest, had gained attention for an education initiative by President Julius Maada Bio that sent many more children to school.

title: What Will Happen to Prigozhin and His Wagner Fighters? Here’s What We Know.
description: Days after an uprising in Russia, Moscow said the charges of “armed mutiny” would be dropped. Here is how the events may affect the mercenary fighters, President Vladimir V. Putin and the war in Ukraine.

title: How Russia’s Allies May React to Prigozhin’s Mutiny Against Putin
description: Leaders from Iran, Qatar and Saudi Arabia, among others, expressed support for Vladimir Putin in the face of the Wagner uprising. But concerns may linger, analysts say.

title: At Least Three Die in Egyptian Building Collapse
description: The authorities in Alexandria said three bodies had been pulled from the rubble of the building that collapsed in the city on Monday.

title: Russia Drops Criminal Charges Against Prigozhin After Wagner Rebellion
description: The Russian authorities said that Wagner members would face no criminal charges for the mutiny and would hand over equipment, but the fate of the group’s thousands of fighters was unclear.

title: 115 Degrees Fahrenheit
description: Summer technically just began, and parts of the U.S. already have dangerous heat.

title: Russia Drops Criminal Case Against Mercenary Leader, but His Future Remains Uncertain
description: Russian investigators dropped an investigation into the mutiny led by Yevgeny Prigozhin, head of the Wagner group. It’s unclear where Mr. Prigozhin is days after the insurrection.

title: How Indigenous Guardsman Rescued Children After Plane Crash in the Amazon
description: Colombia’s Indigenous Guard has long had to fight for a space in the national narrative. Today, it is at the center of the country’s biggest story.

title: Call of the Rewild: Restoring Ecological Health to the Emerald Isle
description: Centuries of overgrazing and deforestation have eliminated most native flora in Ireland, creating what ecologists see as a man-made desert in places. A growing “rewilding” push aims to change that.

title: Deforestation in Tropical Forests Increases,
description: Deforestation rates appear “headed in the wrong direction” despite international pledges to halt destruction, according to an annual assessment.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: An angry speech by Vladimir Putin.

title: Prigozhin’s Wagner Rebellion Came as His Power Faded
description: Whatever the Wagner uprising says about Vladimir Putin’s hold on the Kremlin, it is also the story of a mercurial mercenary leader’s growing desperation.

title: Prince Harry’s Lawyers to Make Closing Remarks: What to Know About the Court Case
description: The prince has sued a British media company, Mirror Group Newspapers, claiming that reporters hacked his phone more than a decade ago.

title: Putin Says Russia Is United Behind Him, After Ending Wagner Rebellion
description: President Vladimir V. Putin spoke angrily of those who want “Russians to fight each other,” but his former ally, Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, said the mutiny he led was not a coup attempt.
